net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Interface ResourceManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ResourceManagerImpl

    public interface ResourceManager

    Manages resources for purposes of caching and sharing.

    Resource objects are registered and unregistered in this class. You must be sure to unregister resources when no longer valid to prevent memory leaks.

    Resources may be registered individually or using a name. Named resources are used to shared resources across components. If a resource with the given name is already registered, the existing ID is returned.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • destroy

        void destroy(net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Resource resource)
        Remove the resource from any caches.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource.

      • destroyFactoryResource

        void destroyFactoryResource(String fid,
                          String rid)
        Destroy a FactoryResource by identifier. Removes the resource from any caches.
        Parameters:
        fid - the factory id.
        rid - the resource id.

      • getDynamicFactoryId

        String getDynamicFactoryId()
        Get the ID for the factory that handles dynamic resources.
        Returns:
        String.

      • getFactory

        ResourceFactory getFactory(String factoryId)
        Get a registered factory by name.
        Parameters:
        factoryId - the factory ID.
        Returns:
        ResourceFactory or null if none registered.

      • getResource

        net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Resource getResource(String id)
        Get a resource by ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The id for the resource.
        Returns:
        The Resource.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is no resource registered by the given id.

      • getResourceFromFactory

        FactoryBasedResource getResourceFromFactory(String factoryId,
                                          String persistentResourceId)
        Get a factory resource. The returned resource may not be the same object returned from the associated factory. It may be cached. Do not register the resource using one of the register methods. This method implicitly registers the resource in an appropriate way for factory resources.
        Parameters:
        factoryId - the factory ID as returned by ResourceFactory.getFactoryId().
        persistentResourceId - the persistent resource ID, defined by the factory instance.
        Returns:
        Resource or null if the resource cannot be created.

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Resource resource)
        Invalidate any cached copy of the resource.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to invalidate.

      • invalidateFactoryResource

        void invalidateFactoryResource(String fid,
                             String rid)
        Invalidate a FactoryResource by identifier.
        Parameters:
        fid - the factory id.
        rid - the resource id.
